page.title: 03PUBLIC HOUSES IN BARROW
page.content: {Barrow}is on a hill and has many pubs. Two are on the main road. They are called{The Hammer and Pincers}and{The {Three Crowns. The Soar Bridge Inn}is situated between the river and the busy road to Quorn.Because of this it probably gets more trade. The Inn next to the canal is named{The Navigation as it was used by the navvies who built the canal.{The Hunting Lodge}is on the road to Sileby and is about 100 years old. It was built as a house for Mr. Martin. He fed the poor during the war and as a result of his kindness there is an avenue named after him in the village.{The Soar Bridge Inn}used to be called The Railway when there was a railway over the road and before that The Boatman's Rest. It is about three hundred years old. All the pubs sell good food and drink. {Rachel Anderson
